```{r libraries, message=FALSE}
library('SingleCellExperiment')
library('DropletUtils')
library('scater')
library('scDblFinder')
library('edgeR')
#library('scuttle')
# scater, scran, uwot

```

```{r readData}
# set local path
local.path <- getwd()
setwd(local.path)
patient2_HS.path <- file.path("data", "patient2_HS")

# read in unfiltered data
fname <- file.path(patient2_HS.path, "outs/raw_feature_bc_matrix")
sce.patient2_HS <- read10xCounts(fname, col.names=TRUE)

# rename genes
rownames(sce.patient2_HS) <- uniquifyFeatureNames(rowData(sce.patient2_HS)$ID, rowData(sce.patient2_HS)$Symbol)

# put antibody data in seperate summarizedExperiment inside our singleCellExperiment
sce.patient2_HS <- splitAltExps(sce.patient2_HS, rowData(sce.patient2_HS)$Type)
# altExp(sce.patient2_HS)

# from sparse to normal matrix for downstream analysis
counts(altExp(sce.patient2_HS)) <- as.matrix(counts(altExp(sce.patient2_HS)))

```

```{r qualityControl_Antibodies}
# remove cells that have failed to capture/sequence antibodies, remove cells that have unusually low numbers antibodies (less than or equal to half of the total number of tags)
df.ab.patient2_HS <- perCellQCMetrics(altExp(sce.patient2_HS))

# exclude antibodies with zero counts across all cells
number.nonzero.patient2_HS <- sum(!rowAlls(counts(altExp(sce.patient2_HS)), value=0L))
#discard.ab.patient2_HS <- df.ab.patient2_HS$detected <= number.nonzero.patient2_HS/2
discard.ab.patient2_HS <- df.ab.patient2_HS$detected <= 25

summary(discard.ab.patient2_HS)

# distribution of the number of detected antibodies across all cells, redline=threshold, below cells are discarded (looks like almost all?)
hist(df.ab.patient2_HS$detected, col='grey', main="", xlab="Number of detected Antibody-tags")
#abline(v=number.nonzero.patient2_HS/2, col="red", lty=2)

abline(v=25, col="red", lty=2)


## Should we really discard all these cells (666424), would only keep 70856?
## I wouldn't think so, but in the pipeline in the bioconductor this is what would be done...
```

```{r qualityControl_emptyDroplets}
# using emptyDrops
set.seed(11)

# use emptyDrops algorithm to predict which cells are probably empty
e.out.patient2_HS <- emptyDrops(counts(sce.patient2_HS), niters = 50000, test.ambient=TRUE)

# look at sum summary statistics (non-significant & limited field should be 0, otherwise ran emptyDrops again with higher niters)
summary(e.out.patient2_HS$FDR <= 0.001)
table(Sig=e.out.patient2_HS$FDR <= 0.001, Limited=e.out.patient2_HS$Limited)

# should have an approx. uniform distribution, especially at the beginning (if high peaks there, decrease lower in emptyDrops)
hist(e.out.patient2_HS$PValue[e.out.patient2_HS$Total <= 100 & e.out.patient2_HS$Total > 0],
    xlab="P-value", main="", col="grey80")

# subset sce
sce.patient2_HS <- sce.patient2_HS[, which(e.out.patient2_HS$FDR <= 0.001)]
```

```{r qualityControl_doublets}
# compute score for each each cell reperesenting how likely it is a doublet
sce.patient2_HS <- scDblFinder(sce.patient2_HS)
table(sce.patient2_HS$scDblFinder.class)

# removing doublets
sce.patient2_HS <- sce.patient2_HS[, sce.patient2_HS$scDblFinder.class!="doublet"]
```

```{r qualityControl_deadCells}
# discard dead cells by looking at where there's high percentage of mitochondrial RNA
mito <- grep("^MT-", rowData(sce.patient2_HS)$Symbol)
df.mito.patient2_HS <- perCellQCMetrics(sce.patient2_HS, subsets=list(Mito=mito))
discard.mito.patient2_HS <- isOutlier(df.mito.patient2_HS$subsets_Mito_percent, type="higher")

# looks like quite a lot of cells?
summary(discard.mito.patient2_HS)

# plot cells which are dismissed bc. of high mitochondrial expression, don't want to dismiss any in the upper right corner, which are high quality cells
plot(df.mito.patient2_HS$sum, df.mito.patient2_HS$subsets_Mito_percent, log="x",
    xlab="Total count", ylab='Mitochondrial %') 
abline(h=attr(discard.mito.patient2_HS, "thresholds")["higher"], col="red")
```

```{r qualityControl_outliers}
# compute outliers bc. of low library sizes and detection rates
qc.lib2.patient2_HS <- isOutlier(df.mito.patient2_HS$sum, log=TRUE, type="lower")
qc.nexprs2.patient2_HS <- isOutlier(df.mito.patient2_HS$detected, log=TRUE, type="lower")

# discard all low quality cells (not including antibody quality assesment since otherwise almost all cells would be discarded)
discard.patient2_HS <- qc.lib2.patient2_HS | qc.nexprs2.patient2_HS | discard.mito.patient2_HS

# overviews of discarded cells
DataFrame(LibSize=sum(qc.lib2.patient2_HS), NExprs=sum(qc.nexprs2.patient2_HS), MitoProp=sum(discard.mito.patient2_HS), Total=sum(discard.patient2_HS))

# plotting of the above metrics, tails are things we want to get rid of
qc.patient2_HS <- as.data.frame((df.mito.patient2_HS))
# don't want tail on right side
ggplot(qc.patient2_HS, aes(subsets_Mito_percent)) + geom_histogram() 
# don't want tail on left side
ggplot(qc.patient2_HS, aes(log10(sum))) + geom_histogram() 
# number of reads should correlate with the number of genes detected??
ggplot(qc.patient2_HS, aes(log10(sum), log10(detected))) + geom_point() + geom_density2d()

```


```{r checkQualityControl}
# check that an entire cell type is not inadvertently discarded
lost.patient2_HS <- calculateAverage(counts(sce.patient2_HS)[, !discard.patient2_HS])
kept.patient2_HS <- calculateAverage(counts(sce.patient2_HS)[, discard.patient2_HS])

logged.patient2_HS <- edgeR::cpm(cbind(lost.patient2_HS, kept.patient2_HS), log=TRUE, prior.count=2)
logFC.patient2_HS <- logged.patient2_HS[, 1] - logged.patient2_HS[, 2]
abundance.patient2_HS <- rowMeans(logged.patient2_HS)

plot(abundance.patient2_HS, logFC.patient2_HS, xlab="Average count", ylab="Log-FC (lost/kept)", pch=16)
```

```{r discardLowQualityCells}
# discard low quality cells
sce.patient2_HS <- sce.patient2_HS[, !discard.patient2_HS]
```
